definition: nothing much changes (idiom); always the same/stuck in a rut
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion

sentences.english: Its pleadings will not bear to be stereotyped.
sentences.chinese: 它的诉诸同情的方法不能一成不变。

sentences.english: The rites of preparing for bed were elaborate and unchanging .
sentences.chinese: 铺床叠被是细致复杂而又一成不变的仪式。

sentences.english: But, despite huge upheavals in the world, little has altered.
sentences.chinese: 纵观国际社会乱象纷生，联合国却几乎一成不变。

sentences.english: There are no hard-and-fast rules for success.
sentences.chinese: 通往成功没有什么一成不变的规则。

sentences.english: Once again, I had congee for breakfast.
sentences.chinese: 早饭还是那一成不变的粥。

sentences.english: Remember, no decision is set in stone.
sentences.chinese: 记住，没有决定是一成不变的。

sentences.english: Sure, men stereotypically like to solve a woman's problems.
sentences.chinese: 当然，男人总会一成不变地喜欢解决女人的问题。

sentences.english: Unique technology with inalterable earths ensures exquisite wear all day.
sentences.chinese: 独特的技术与精湛的一成不变地球确保一整天不掉妆。

sentences.english: Literature teaching methods and approaches should be flexible and various.
sentences.chinese: 外国文学教学的方法应该是灵活多样的而非一成不变。

sentences.english: I will invariably get it wrong and make us even more late.
sentences.chinese: 我总是会一成不变地挑错衣服，这只会让我们更迟。

sentences.english: There is no time for cut-and-dried monotony. There is time for work.
sentences.chinese: 没有时间做一成不变的单调事。

sentences.english: The trunk is always the same, but the branches and leaves are stretched and stretched.
sentences.chinese: 树干总是一成不变，枝叶却纷披而伸展。

sentences.english: That is the unvarying standard of my feelings.
sentences.chinese: 这就是我一成不变的感情。

sentences.english: Clouds are impermanent, but the sky is stable.
sentences.chinese: 云变幻莫测，天空却是一成不变。

sentences.english: If you want things to stay as they are, things will have to continuously change.
sentences.chinese: 如果期待事情一成不变，事情的状况越是百变。

sentences.english: The inalterable routine of a physician.
sentences.chinese: 世界上没有一成不变的东西。

definition: thousand articles, same rule (idiom); stereotyped and repetitive/once you've seen one, you've seen them all
(idiom) to continue in the same old rut/diehard conservative attitudes
old-fashioned/out of date/to be later than the time stipulated or agreed upon
to transform/to convert/to vary/to alternate/a transformation
stuck in the old ways (idiom); refusing to acknowledge new ideas/stagnating and conservative
